title: ‘A win for Everett’: How readers reacted to New England Revolution stadium deal
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Readers Say “While there are challenges .
this is a win for Everett, Boston, and New England sports.
” New England Revolution fans cheer on their team in the first half of an MLS soccer match against Toronto FC on March 3, 2024 in Foxborough, Mass.

title: U-Haul ranks Massachusetts near the bottom for growth — again
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The state improved slightly to 46th place, up from 49th last year.

John Tlumacki / The Boston Globe, File Massachusetts continues to lag in population growth, landing 46th in the 2025 U-Haul Growth Index — a modest rise from 49th last year but still firmly in the bottom five states for migration.
The state has consistently ranked low on the U-Haul Growth Index, with data showing more one-way rentals leaving the state than entering it.

title: Osteria Nino in Burlington closes after 10 years in business
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Restaurants The reason for the closure was "to make way for new ownership and a revitalized concept.
" Osteria Nino in Burlington has closed after 10 years in business.
Aram Boghosian for The Boston Globe Osteria Nino, an Italian restaurant that served the Burlington community for a decade, has shuttered, according to an announcement on the restaurant’s website.

title: 14-year-old boy suffers head injury in Brookline crash
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The teen was not wearing a helmet as he rode a motor scooter down Harvard Street, police said.
A 14-year-old boy suffered a serious head injury Thursday during a crash on Harvard Street in Brookline.

Brookline Police Department By Abby Patkin January 8, 2026 | 9:40 AM 1 minute to read A 14-year-old boy suffered a serious head injury Thursday morning when his motor scooter collided with a car that was making a left turn onto a busy Brookline roadway, according to police.

title: Roofer dies after fall from Danvers home
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The man fell from a roof on Wednesday morning.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A worker died after he fell from a roof in Danvers on Wednesday morning, prompting an ongoing investigation by local and state police.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Jan. 8, 2026)

title: Precarious living at a cliff’s edge goes for $100K in Cape Cod
author: Regina Cole
bullets: Real Estate Two houses on the same street in Eastham recently sold or went under contract for about $100,000 — but how long before the ocean claims them?
The house at 153 Brownell Road in Eastham is located 16 feet from a cliff's edge.

title: Jaylen Brown scores 33, but Celtics fall to shorthanded Nuggets: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Boston Celtics The Celtics lost to the Nuggets 114-110 Wednesday night, snapping a five-game win streak for Boston.
Boston Celtics guard Jaylen Brown heads up court after his shot gave Boston a 23-22 lead during the 1st quarter.
